explanation:
To prove the target does not (directly or indirectly) call itself you must inspect every function it calls and any functions they call. In the target function the explicit callees to check are:

- MHD_DLOG — the only callee listed in the provided static call graph. You must verify MHD_DLOG (and anything it calls) does not call, directly or indirectly, MHD_connection_set_cork_state_.
- setsockopt — a libc/system call invoked in the function. Although unlikely, include it to confirm there is no callback path into library or application code that could reach MHD_connection_set_cork_state_.
- MHD_socket_get_error_ — called after a failed setsockopt; inspect it to ensure it does not lead back to the target.
- MHD_socket_strerr_ — used to format error messages; inspect it to ensure it does not lead back to the target.

You do not need to include socket-option macros/constants or simple inline error-check macros unless they expand to or invoke functions that can transitively call back into MHD_connection_set_cork_state_. These listed symbols are the close set required to determine whether any callee chain from the target can reach the target itself (i.e., create recursion).
